original_title: Miles Davis Live at Berlin Philharmonie
overview: By 1973, Miles Davis and his bad were "fully electrified, with electric guitar and bass replacing the more traditional jazz instruments." Recording during the septet's European tour in that period, this Italian pressing on clear green vinyl captures jazz fusion at its finest - double drummers (James Mtume on congas and Al Foster on drums), a range of hand percussion instruments, Davis playing his trumpet through a wah wah pedal, funky organs, etc... If you're a Miles Davis fan, this is a no brainer!
title: Miles Davis Live at Berlin Philharmonie
